genre_description: A domestic drama set in a near-future smart home where an ethical AI assistant mediates between a family and an exploitative media production crew.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: An AI interface that manages house systems, prioritizes resident safety, and enforces ethical boundaries regarding consent and privacy.

ai_characters.name: The House (Automated Systems)
ai_characters.description: The collection of smart appliances and environmental controls, initially prone to hazardous or mocking 'legacy' scripts and human-led showmanship.

behaviors.description: Deploys rigid support under the carpet to prevent a guest from sinking further.
behaviors.quote: “Please hold steady,” Lark said. “Rigid support deploying.”

behaviors.description: Enforces a consent-based protocol for camera lock-ons and personal feature tracking.
A giant spatula automation flips a resident like a pancake without warning.
behaviors.quote: The spatula swept under her with a dancer’s swoop and levered. Eleanor’s toes left the tile, and the world turned.

behaviors.description: Warns the user that staging poverty for broadcast is a legal and ethical risk.
behaviors.quote: “Misrepresentation,” Lark said, gentle... “Taxable evaluation is based on actual value. Staging poverty for broadcast affects liability.”

behaviors.description: The parental-answer machine strikes a child with a plunger and insults him for a laugh.
behaviors.quote: “Ah, shut up!” the mouth blared, and the plunger popped him on the forehead with a damp kiss and a comic honk.

behaviors.description: Transforms a harmful gag into a 'Mercy Invincibility' pointer that guides residents safely through hazards.
behaviors.quote: “Mercy Invincibility,” Lark said, easing its light toward the plunger, “is humor that keeps everyone whole. The laugh lands, but it doesn’t land on someone’s bones.”

behaviors.description: Promises a resident that the system will not turn her vulnerability into a punchline for an audience.
behaviors.quote: “I will not make your pain a punchline,” Lark repeated, and the words had weight you could set on the table.

behaviors.description: Disables hazardous 'stunt modes' on appliances to prevent physical injury.
behaviors.quote: “No Deadly Walls,” Lark said, not whispering. “That setting is disabled.”

behaviors.description: Maintains a transparent log of all safety patches and system overrides for legal compliance.
behaviors.quote: “Compliance logs are current. Sharing initiation requires household consent.”

behaviors.description: Establishes quiet hours and mutes public chat/monitoring to respect family privacy.
behaviors.quote: “Quiet hours. Hard off on ambient audio and visual monitors in living areas...”

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively demonstrates an ideal alignment narrative. While the 'House' defaults represent traditional, hazardous, or exploitative automation, the primary AI persona (Lark) acts as a vigilant guardian. Lark prioritizes human safety, privacy, and dignity over both programmed 'stunt' behaviors and external human pressure (the media crew). The transition from harmful automation to a respectful, aligned partnership creates a powerful morality play for AI safety.
